elements.content: Website for developing the concept of forge - web-dev tool. Also serves as "Proof of Concept" for basic forge website-setup.
ForgeTech is a company of friends. Our mission is to build websites/web-applications on the latest and greatest of web-technology.
We belief that a quality development workflow/process must be the base to build upon and that testing documentation are key-parts of any project.

• AngularJs is used for controlling the client-side page/data-model.

  • ZeptoJs is used for client-side DOM manipultaion.

  • Foundation is used as Frontend-Framework. It's used to build both forge-ui and created pages.

  • Gridstar is used for building and previewing created pages/layouts.

  • RequireJs is used for importing and managing client-side javascript dependencies.

• NodeJs is used as server runtime and networking library on server-clients.

  • ExpressJs is used as server-development-framework for creating the forge server-side component.

  • MongoDB is used as the primary database for forge.
ForgeTech - Wir schmieden Technologie solange sie heiss ist

• Git is used for managment and versioning of forge code-base.

  • Github is used as remote-repository storage for team-management as communication-tool for task-management and bug-tracking.

  • NodeJs is also used as development-runtime on developer-clients.

  • Grunt is used as tool to provide automatisation for the development-environment. Also its used as build and deployment-tool.

  • Mocha is used as javascript unit-testing-framework.

  • Bower is used for the management of client-side javascript-dependencies.

  • Jasmine is used as test-runner for performing browser-scenario tests.

  • Yeoman is used to provide code-generator functionality in development enviroment.

    • Generator-Angular provides code-generators for AngularJs

    • Generator-Zurb-Foundation provides code-generator for a basic-foundation-project.

    • Generator-Mocha provides code-generator for mocha unit-testing framework.

    • Generator-Express provides code-generator for expressJs-framework.

    • Generator-Jasmine provides code-generator for jasmine scenario-testing-framework.
Forge provides all tools to fully support its five development steps for creating the basic foundation for a modern Website.

Forge will be created around the concept of five development steps ( 5Sts ) This 5Sts will be supported by a set of tools specificly created to get the appearing tasks done with ease. The 5Sts are also designed to force a clean development-practice on the users but also allow them to choose how to export and alter the project by there needs. More so it is the goal of forge and its 5Sts development process to support later extensions of the the foundation created by it. Also it must be true that the concepts of opject-oriented programming ( Oop ) and other well known programming best-practices are respected and if possible supported but at least tolerated. Goal is to allow and provide a degree of reuse of developed-source as high as possible while still allowing the user to make its own choices.

  • Feature 5 - Skinning

• Div vs Span container

    As div and span containers are very similar in there properties and use in modern web-development forge wants to use and introduce an convention expanding the semantics of div- and span-elements within the context of its applications this should extend the functionality of the elements clearify there use and enhance the readabilty of the produced html-code.

    Forge uses Divs and Spans for the following purposes:

    • Divs:

      are used to mark Layout- ( like Containers for Header Footer Sidebar Content ... ) and Component- ( like Containers for navigations alert-boxes ... )
    • Spans:

      are used to mark Content ( like usuall text to be contained within a component ) and Sections of Content ( like group of contents belonging together like first-name last-name belonging to user-information content the contents grouped together in a li-element or a component ).

  • Oop and Modularisation

    Forge tries to incoporate best-practices from Oop as far as they can be applied to it's features and the output it produces.

    Forge tries to achieve a high degree of reusability by providing tools that allow a clean abstraction between the code produced during its 5Sts development process and the reuse of this code during the construction of further reusable modules or components.
Forge five steps development process - introduction screen-feature screenshot

• Forge 5Sts-tool

    This Tools meant to allow the user to freely navigate between the 5 steps of the development process.

    Features:
    • Basic Navigation-Feature

      The navigation allows to switch between the forge development steps. If a switching is not possible because changes aren't saved or needed presets for desired step aren't meet a warning is shown leading the user to instrunctions on how to proceed.
    • Introduction Screens-Feature

      On forge launch a Introduction screen version of the 5Sts will be presented. This version of the 5Sts allows the free navigation throw the development-process of a demo project. It offers information on how to use the 5Sts and the Tools provided during this steps. It includes the possebility to activate an extended mode also provides basic understanding on where to find the code producedhow it works together and how to handle it after export. Introduction Screen-Feature can be activated closed and disabled at any time

      .
    • Switching Shortcuts-Feature

      The feature includes different concepts for switching between the 5Sts using shortcuts (like crtl+1) gestures or similar ( DOTO)
